programme.title: TGL Golf
programme.desc: Jupiter Links GC (1-1-0) earned two points and secured its first win with a 4-3 overtime victory over Boston Common Golf on Jan. 27; New York Golf Club (0-2-0) suffered the first shutout in league history with a 4-0 setback to Atlanta Drive GC.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 23 Kansas (17-8, 8-6) is 3-6 on the road this season despite Hunter Dickinson, who is fifth in the Big 12 with 16.4 ppg; BYU (17-8, 8-5) won six of its last eight games behind Richie Saunders, and upset the Jayhawks last season, 76-68.

programme.title: SportsCenter with Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: Host Scott Van Pelt covers all of the important stories of the day, including game highlights, player interviews, and special segments; correspondents relay up-to-the-minute news and game-day reports from major sporting events.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Arkansas (15-10, 4-8) comes off a 69-61 loss to Texas A&M on Feb. 15; No. 1 Auburn (23-2, 11-1) is 10-1 at home, and is top five in the country in scoring, averaging 85.1 ppg behind Johni Broome, who is the only SEC playing averaging a double-double.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: NC State (10-15, 3-11) seeks its first win away from home this season, starting 0-9; North Carolina (15-11, 8-6) beat the Wolfpack, 63-61, on Jan. 11 behind 21 points from Ian Jackson for its seventh win in the last nine meetings.

programme.title: UFC Top 10
programme.desc: The hosts do a top 10 countdown as they take an in-depth look at many of the greatest moments in the history of the Ultimate Fighting Championship, and examine the most brutal knockouts, stunning upsets and devastating brawls.

programme.title: UFC Main Event
programme.desc: Main event bouts from previous UFC cards are featured to show some of the top matches that have occurred over the years as belts are put on the line, reputations are challenged between longtime rivals and impressive victories are featured.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Oklahoma (16-9, 3-9) dropped its last four games after an 82-79 loss to LSU; No. 2 Florida (22-3, 9-3) won four straight, and is 12-1 at home behind Walter Clayton Jr., who leads the Gators in scoring with 17.2 ppg and assists with 4.3 apg.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 5 Houston (21-4, 13-1) won four-straight games, and is 7-0 on the road behind the top scoring defense in the country, holding opponents to 57.3 ppg; Arizona State (12-13, 3-11) dropped its last five games after a 74-70 loss to TCU.

programme.title: Good Guy/Bad Guy
programme.desc: UFC heavyweight and light heavyweight champion Daniel Cormier and UFC Hall of Fame member Chael Sonnen break down the latest from around the MMA world, recapping recent marquee events, the latest injury updates and guest interviews.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Gonzaga (20-7, 11-3) won four-straight games, and beat the Cougars, 88-75, on Jan. 11 behind 21 points from Graham Ike, who is fourth in the WCC in scoring with 16.7 ppg; Washington State (16-11, 6-8) is 9-2 at home behind Nate Calmese.

programme.title: The Mina Kimes Show featuring Lenny
programme.desc: Mina Kimes brings her vast NFL knowledge and unique insight to the top stories making headlines across the league, breaking down the impact of the news, and is joined by guests to gather a different perspective on all things football.

programme.title: UFC Main Event
programme.desc: Dominick Cruz (22-2, 7 KO's) has beaten his last 12 opponents, and defeated Faber by unanimous decision in their last meeting at UFC 132, on Jul. 2, 2011; Uriah Faber (33-8, 7 KO's) is coming off a win over Frankie Saenz at UFC 194 on Dec. 12, 2015.

programme.title: UFC Main Event
programme.desc: Main event bouts from previous UFC cards are featured to show some of the top matches that have occurred over the years as belts are put on the line, reputations are challenged between longtime rivals and impressive victories are featured.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Cincinnati (15-10, 5-9) had its three-win streak snapped by Iowa State, 81-70; West Virginia (15-10, 6-8) is 10-4 at home, and beat the Bearcats, 63-50, on Feb. 2 behind 19 points from Javon Small, who leads Big 12 scoring with 18.6 ppg.

programme.desc: Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon, longtime colleagues and friends, engage in verbal sparring during a fast-paced and wide-ranging discussion about current events in the world of sports; Kornheiser and Wilbon also interview special guests.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Loyola Marymount (15-12, 7-8) dropped four of its last five games, but beat the Broncos, 57-54, on Jan. 16 behind 19 points from Caleb Stone-Carrawell; Santa Clara (17-10, 9-5) is 10-3 at home behind Adama-Alpha Bal, who leads the team with 13.7 ppg.

programme.title: The Domonique Foxworth Show
programme.desc: Former NFL cornerback Domonique Foxworth shares his thoughts on the latest news making headlines from the sport he played, along with reactions to latest around the world of sports and guest interviews to gain a unique perspective.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Wichita State (15-10, 5-7) won its last four games after an 84-79 overtime upset of then-No. 14 Memphis; Florida Atlantic (15-10, 8-4) won five-straight games, and won both meetings with the Shockers last season, including an 86-77 home win.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Louisville claimed a 61-44 victory over Duke in their lone meeting from the 2023-24 season on Jan. 4, 2024, behind Kiki Jefferson's 15 points and 4 rebounds; Oluchi Okananwa posted 14 points and 5 rebounds for the Blue Devils in the home loss.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The Lakers and Celtics met in the NBA Finals for the first time in 1959, and in the 1960s the two franchises battled for the title six times; Bill Russell was a dominant figure for the Celtics, and Los Angeles featured Jerry West and Elgin Baylor.

programme.title: UFC Live
programme.desc: The latest news and updates surrounding the fighters competing in the upcoming UFC event are featured, breaking down the fight card with in-depth analysis of the premier matches highlighting the event, along with profiles of the combatants.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: In 1978, the Celtics drafted Larry Bird, but he played his final year at Indiana State before signing; Los Angeles selected Magic Johnson No. 1 in 1979 after he led Michigan State to a victory over Bird and the Sycamores in the NCAA title game.

programme.desc: Illinois (17-9, 9-7) won its last nine meetings with the Badgers after an 86-80 win on Dec. 10; No. 11 Wisconsin (20-5, 10-4) won four-straight games, and is 12-1 at home behind John Tonje, who is top five in Big Ten scoring with 19.2 ppg.

programme.desc: Vancouver Whitecaps FC is just 1-1-6 over its last eight Concacaf Champions League matches after suffering a 3-0 setback to Tigres UANL on Feb. 14, 2024; Costa Rican side Deportivo Saprissa has won the tournament three times (1993, 1995, 2005).

programme.title: Saudi Pro League Soccer
programme.desc: Al-Ahli claimed a 4-2 victory over Damac in their first meeting of the season on Sept. 20, led by a brace and assist from forward Ivan Toney; midfielder Gabri Veiga posted a goal and a pair of assists for Al-Ahli in the win at home.

programme.title: Saudi Pro League Soccer
programme.desc: Al-Nassr claimed a 3-0 victory over Al-Ettifaq in their first meeting of the season on Sept. 20, led by a pair of assists from Sadio Mané in the second half; Cristiano Ronaldo, Salem Alnajdi and Anderson Talisca found the net for Al-Nassr in the win.

programme.title: 2025 CONCACAF Women's U-20 Qualifiers
programme.desc: Bermuda U20 won its last CONCACAF U20 qualifier after defeating Anguilla U20, 3-1, on April 18, 2023; Trinidad & Tobago U20 seeks its best finish in the tournament since earning a fourth-place finish in the 2014 edition held in the Cayman Islands.
